features.name: Nullable reference type annotations
features.description: System.Text.Json adds support for nullable reference type annotations and exporting JSON schemas from types.

features.name: CountBy
features.description: Returns the count of elements in the source sequence grouped by key.

features.name: AggregateBy
features.description: Applies an accumulator function over a sequence, grouping results by key.

features.name: Index
features.description: Returns an enumerable that incorporates the element's index into a tuple.

features.name: Browser telemetry support
features.description: The dashboard supports OpenTelemetry Protocol (OTLP) over HTTP and cross-origin resource sharing (CORS). These features unlock the ability to send OpenTelemetry from browser apps to the .NET Aspire dashboard.

features.name: params collections
features.description: The params modifier isn't limited to array types. You can now use params with any recognized collection type.

features.name: Static asset delivery optimization
features.description: MapStaticAssets routing endpoint conventions is a new feature that optimizes the delivery of static assets in ASP.NET Core apps.

features.name: .NET MAUI Blazor Hybrid and Web App solution template
features.description: A new solution template makes it easier to create .NET MAUI native and Blazor web client apps that share the same UI. This template shows how to create client apps that maximize code reuse and target Android, iOS, Mac, Windows, and Web.

features.name: Detect rendering location, interactivity, and assigned render mode at runtime
features.description: A new API designed to simplify the process of querying component states at runtime.

features.name: Simplified authentication state serialization for Blazor Web Apps
features.description: New APIs make it easier to add authentication to an existing Blazor Web App. When you create a new Blazor Web App with authentication using Individual Accounts and you enable WebAssembly-based interactivity, the project includes a custom AuthenticationStateProvider in both the server and client projects.

features.name: Add static server-side rendering (SSR) pages to a globally-interactive Blazor Web App
features.description: It's now simpler to add static SSR pages to apps that adopt global interactivity.

features.name: Constructor injection
features.description: Razor components support constructor injection.

features.name: Websocket compression for Interactive Server components
features.description: By default, Interactive Server components enable compression for WebSocket connections and set a frame-ancestors Content Security Policy (CSP) directive set to 'self', which only permits embedding the app in an <iframe> of the origin from which the app is served when compression is enabled or when a configuration for the WebSocket context is provided.

features.name: Handle keyboard composition events in Blazor.
features.description: The new KeyboardEventArgs.IsComposing property indicates if the keyboard event is part of a composition session. Tracking the composition state of keyboard events is crucial for handling international character input methods.

features.name: Added OverscanCount parameter to QuickGrid
features.description: The QuickGrid component now exposes an OverscanCount property that specifies how many additional rows are rendered before and after the visible region when virtualization is enabled.

features.name: InputNumber component supports the type="range" attribute
features.description: The InputNumber<TValue> component now supports the type="range" attribute, which creates a range input that supports model binding and form validation, typically rendered as a slider or dial control rather than a text box.

features.name: New enhanced navigation events
features.description: Trigger JavaScript callbacks either before or after enhanced navigation with new event listeners.

features.name: Polymorphic type support in SignalR Hubs
features.description: Hub methods can now accept a base class instead of the derived class to enable polymorphic scenarios. The base type needs to be annotated to allow polymorphism.

features.name: Improved Activities for SignalR
features.description: SignalR now has an ActivitySource for both the hub server and client.

features.name: SignalR supports trimming and Native AOT
features.description: Enables trimming and native ahead-of-time (AOT) compilation support for both SignalR client and server scenarios. You can now take advantage of the performance benefits of using Native AOT in applications that use SignalR for real-time web communications.

features.name: Added InternalServerError and InternalServerError<TValue> to TypedResults
features.description: TypedResults now includes factory methods and types for returning "500 Internal Server Error" responses from endpoints.

features.name: Call ProducesProblem and ProducesValidationProblem on route groups
features.description: The ProducesProblem and ProducesValidationProblem extension methods have been updated to support their use on route groups.

features.name: Problem and ValidationProblem result types support construction with IEnumerable<KeyValuePair<string, object?>> values
features.description: Prior to .NET 9, constructing Problem and ValidationProblem result types in minimal APIs required that the errors and extensions properties be initialized with an implementation of IDictionary<string, object?>. In this release, these construction APIs support overloads that consume IEnumerable<KeyValuePair<string, object?>>.

features.name: OpenAPI document generation
features.description: Built-in support for generating OpenAPI documents from ASP.NET Core web APIs.

features.name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.OpenApi supports trimming and Native AOT
features.description: OpenAPI in ASP.NET Core supports trimming and native AOT. The following steps create and publish an OpenAPI app with trimming and native AOT.

features.name: Pushed Authorization Requests (PAR)
features.description: OpenIdConnectHandler adds support for Pushed Authorization Requests (PAR).

features.name: OIDC and OAuth Parameter Customization
features.description: The OAuth and OIDC authentication handlers now have an AdditionalAuthorizationParameters option to make it easier to customize authorization message parameters that are usually included as part of the redirect query string.

features.name: Configure HTTP.sys extended authentication flags
features.description: You can now configure the HTTP_AUTH_EX_FLAG_ENABLE_KERBEROS_CREDENTIAL_CACHING and HTTP_AUTH_EX_FLAG_CAPTURE_CREDENTIAL HTTP.sys flags by using the new EnableKerberosCredentialCaching and CaptureCredentials properties on the HTTP.sys AuthenticationManager to optimize how Windows authentication is handled.

features.name: New HybridCache library
features.description: The HybridCache API bridges some gaps in the existing IDistributedCache and IMemoryCache APIs.

features.name: Developer exception page improvements
features.description: The ASP.NET Core developer exception page is displayed when an app throws an unhandled exception during development. The developer exception page provides detailed information about the exception and request.

features.name: Dictionary debugging improvements
features.description: The debugging display of dictionaries and other key-value collections has an improved layout.

features.name: Fix for 503's during app recycle in IIS
features.description: By default there is now a 1 second delay between when IIS is notified of a recycle or shutdown and when ANCM tells the managed server to start shutting down. The delay is configurable via the ANCM_shutdownDelay environment variable or by setting the shutdownDelay handler setting.

features.name: ASP0026: Analyzer to warn when [Authorize] is overridden by [AllowAnonymous] from "farther away"
features.description: Introduced an analyzer that will highlight instances like these where a closer [Authorize] attribute gets overridden by an [AllowAnonymous] attribute that is farther away from an MVC action.

features.name: Customize Kestrel named pipe endpoints
features.description: Kestrel's named pipe support has been improved with advanced customization options. The new CreateNamedPipeServerStream method on the named pipe options allows pipes to be customized per-endpoint.

features.name: ExceptionHandlerMiddleware option to choose the status code based on the exception type
features.description: A new option when configuring the ExceptionHandlerMiddleware enables app developers to choose what status code to return when an exception occurs during request handling. The new option changes the status code being set in the ProblemDetails response from the ExceptionHandlerMiddleware.

features.name: Opt-out of HTTP metrics on certain endpoints and requests
features.description: .NET 9 introduces the ability to opt-out of HTTP metrics for specific endpoints and requests.

features.name: Data Protection support for deleting keys
features.description: Prior to .NET 9, data protection keys were not deletable by design, to prevent data loss. Deleting a key renders its protected data irretrievable. Given their small size, the accumulation of these keys generally posed minimal impact. However, to accommodate extremely long-running services, we have introduced the option to delete keys.

features.name: Middleware supports Keyed DI
features.description: Middleware now supports Keyed DI in both the constructor and the Invoke/InvokeAsync method.

features.name: Trust the ASP.NET Core HTTPS development certificate on Linux
features.description: On Ubuntu and Fedora based Linux distros, dotnet dev-certs https --trust now configures ASP.NET Core HTTPS development certificate as a trusted certificate.
